tortoiseshell : a cat with black, brown, and orange fur: Tortoiseshells (often shortened to torties) are almost always female. A tortie and white cat is known as a "calico" or "calico cat" in the United States. Compare
calico
More examplesFewer examplesTortoiseshell cats are often affectionately referred to as torties. The difference between a calico and a tortie is that torties have no white in their coats.Although torties and their multicoloured fur are in a class of their own, there is no such thing as a tortoiseshell cat breed.Torties are mentioned in many tales from folklore around the world.
